title: Weapons/Types

properties.name: description
properties.value: This is a list of weapon types categorised by their Combat Options, which are found in game at the bottom of the tab. Not all weapons follow the standard set of combat options for similar weapons. For example, 3rd age longsword is considered a two-handed sword rather than a slash sword.

content:
"Spiked" redirects here. For other uses, see Spiked (disambiguation).
The Combat Options tab, where weapon type is found.

This is a list of weapon types categorised by their Combat Options, which are found in game at the bottom of the tab. Not all weapons follow the standard set of combat options for similar weapons. For example, 3rd age longsword is considered a two-handed sword rather than a slash sword.

Contents

  • 1 Melee weapons
    • 1.1 Two-handed sword
    • 1.2 Axe
    • 1.3 Banner
    • 1.4 Blunt
      • 1.4.1 Bludgeon
    • 1.5 Bulwark
    • 1.6 Claw
    • 1.7 Partisan
    • 1.8 Pickaxe
    • 1.9 Polearm
    • 1.10 Polestaff
    • 1.11 Scythe
    • 1.12 Slash sword
    • 1.13 Spear
    • 1.14 Spiked
    • 1.15 Stab sword
    • 1.16 Unarmed
    • 1.17 Whip
  • 2 Ranged weapons
    • 2.1 Blaster
    • 2.2 Bow
    • 2.3 Chinchompa
    • 2.4 Crossbow
    • 2.5 Gun
    • 2.6 Thrown
  • 3 Magic weapons
    • 3.1 Bladed staff
    • 3.2 Powered Staff
    • 3.3 Staff
  • 4 Other
    • 4.1 Salamander

Bludgeon[edit | edit source]

Bludgeon is a subset of blunt, where the only difference is that all attack styles are aggressive.

Bow[edit | edit source]

Bows with 9 base attack range will have 10 attack range on the longrange combat style. For bows with 10 base attack range, the longrange combat style will not increase attack range.

Category: BowCombat StyleStyle typeWeapon StyleExperienceInvisible Boost
AccurateRangedAccurateRanged and Hitpoints+3 Ranged
